sense.name: U.S. coin
sense.commentary: a United States coin worth one fourth of a dollar
sense.examples: He fed four quarters into the slot machine. I found a quarter in the street today a treated myself to some gum.

sense.name: one-fourth
sense.commentary: fourth, fourth part, twenty-five percent, quartern - one of four equal parts
sense.examples: A quarter of pound of beef cost me five dollars at that store. The robbers split the loot into four and each took a quarter.

sense.name: sports game
sense.commentary: QUARTER[+event] one of four period of play into which some games are divided
sense.examples: There were so many time-outs that the first quarter lasted two hours. Both teams scored in the first quarter.

sense.name: city district
sense.commentary: a district of a city having some distinguishing character
sense.examples: Our hotel was in the Latin Quarter. The casbah is an older or native quarter of many cities in northern Africa.

sense.name: 15 minutes
sense.commentary: a unit of time equal to 15 minutes or a quarter of an hour
sense.examples: It's a quarter til 4. He didn't tell me until a quarter after four o'clock.

sense.name: school marking period
sense.commentary: QUARTER[+event] one of four periods into which the school year is divided
sense.examples: The last quarter of my academic career will end in June. The fall quarter ends at Christmas. She was so sick that she missed the whole quarter.

sense.name: one fourth of a year
sense.commentary: QUARTER[+event] a fourth part of a year; three months
sense.examples: Unemployment fell during the last quarter.

sense.name: compass direction
sense.commentary: one of the four major divisions of the compass
sense.examples: The wind is coming from that quarter.

sense.name: unspecified person
sense.examples: He dropped a word in the right quarter.

sense.name: ship tail
sense.commentary: stern, after part, poop - the rear part of a ship
sense.examples: He was caught sleeping in the ship's quarter deck.

sense.name: shoe heel
sense.commentary: piece of leather that comprises the part of a shoe or boot covering the heel and joining the vamp
sense.examples: George borrowed my nail gun and now his shoe has one hole in the quarter.

sense.name: 25/28 pounds
sense.examples: A quarter can be either 25 or 28 pounds.
